paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I (p.Val142Ile) including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: aged 76 ± 7, 68% male, all declared African ancestries
patients.phenotype: progressive restrictive cardiomyopathy (CA-TTR) with potential peripheral neuropathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients carrying p. Val142Ile mutation typically develop a progressive restrictive cardiomyopathy (CA-TTR).

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with increased metaboreflex sensitivity and poor aerobic capacity.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families as it is associated with hereditary transthyretin mediated amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study focused on the effects of the V122I variant in a cohort of CA-TTR patients.
key_quotes: The most common transthyretin mutation in African Americans in the United States and African descent in the Caribbean is V122I (p.Val142Ile).
Patients carrying p. Val142Ile mutation typically develop a progressive restrictive cardiomyopathy (CA-TTR).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific variant in the TTR gene.
